trans-unit.source: Using the OneDrive Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the OneDrive Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the OneDrive Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the OneDrive Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the OneDrive Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the OneDrive Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to your OneDrive to upload, download, and delete files.
trans-unit.target: Connect to your OneDrive to upload, download, and delete files.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can add the OneDrive Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the OneDrive Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Creating a OneDrive connector for your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Creating a OneDrive connector for your Logic App

trans-unit.source: To use the OneDrive connector, you need to first create an instance of the OneDrive connector API app.
trans-unit.target: To use the OneDrive connector, you need to first create an instance of the OneDrive connector API app.

trans-unit.source: This can be done from either the logic app designer directly or outside it.
trans-unit.target: This can be done from either the logic app designer directly or outside it.

trans-unit.source: Creating an instance outside the designer can be done as follows:
trans-unit.target: Creating an instance outside the designer can be done as follows:

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure Marketplace from the homepage of Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure Marketplace from the homepage of Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Under "Everything", search for “OneDrive connector”.
trans-unit.target: Under "Everything", search for “OneDrive connector”.

trans-unit.source: Configure the OneDrive connector as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the OneDrive connector as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Name** - give a name for your OneDrive Connector
trans-unit.target: **Name** - give a name for your OneDrive Connector

trans-unit.source: **App Service plan** - select or create a App Service plan
trans-unit.target: **App Service plan** - select or create a App Service plan

trans-unit.source: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector
trans-unit.target: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector

trans-unit.source: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside
trans-unit.target: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside

trans-unit.source: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in
trans-unit.target: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in

trans-unit.source: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed
trans-unit.target: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed

trans-unit.source: Click on Create.
trans-unit.target: Click on Create.

trans-unit.source: A new OneDrive Connector will be created.
trans-unit.target: A new OneDrive Connector will be created.

trans-unit.source: Once the API app instance is created, you can create a logic App in the same resource group to use the OneDrive connector.
trans-unit.target: Once the API app instance is created, you can create a logic App in the same resource group to use the OneDrive connector.

trans-unit.source: Using the OneDrive Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the OneDrive Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the OneDrive connector as an action for your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the OneDrive connector as an action for your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need to:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group which has the OneDrive connector.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group which has the OneDrive connector.

trans-unit.source: Follow instructions to [Create a new Logic App].
trans-unit.target: Follow instructions to [Create a new Logic App].

trans-unit.source: Open “Triggers and Actions” within the created Logic App to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow.
trans-unit.target: Open “Triggers and Actions” within the created Logic App to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow.

trans-unit.source: The OneDrive connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side.
trans-unit.target: The OneDrive connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side.

trans-unit.source: You can drop the OneDrive Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “OneDrive Connector”.
trans-unit.target: You can drop the OneDrive Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “OneDrive Connector”.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Authorize button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Authorize button.

trans-unit.source: Provide your Microsoft credentials (if not automatically signed in).
trans-unit.target: Provide your Microsoft credentials (if not automatically signed in).

trans-unit.source: Click “Yes” to allow access.
trans-unit.target: Click “Yes” to allow access.

trans-unit.source: You can now use the OneDrive connector in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can now use the OneDrive connector in the flow.

trans-unit.source: Currently, triggers are not available within the OneDrive connector.
trans-unit.target: Currently, triggers are not available within the OneDrive connector.

trans-unit.source: The Actions available are - Get File, Upload a File, Delete File and List Files.
trans-unit.target: The Actions available are - Get File, Upload a File, Delete File and List Files.

trans-unit.source: Lets walk through an "Upload File" experience.
trans-unit.target: Lets walk through an "Upload File" experience.

trans-unit.source: You can use the OneDrive action "upload File" to upload a file to your OneDrive account.
trans-unit.target: You can use the OneDrive action "upload File" to upload a file to your OneDrive account.

trans-unit.source: Configure the input properties for "Upload File" action as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the input properties for "Upload File" action as follows:

trans-unit.source: **File Path** - Specify the file path of the file to be uploaded
trans-unit.target: **File Path** - Specify the file path of the file to be uploaded

trans-unit.source: **Content** - Specifies the content of the file to be uploaded
trans-unit.target: **Content** - Specifies the content of the file to be uploaded

trans-unit.source: **Content Transfer Encoding** - Specify none or base64
trans-unit.target: **Content Transfer Encoding** - Specify none or base64

trans-unit.source: **Overwrite** - Specify "true" to overwrite the file if it already exists.
trans-unit.target: **Overwrite** - Specify "true" to overwrite the file if it already exists.

trans-unit.source: This is an advanced property
trans-unit.target: This is an advanced property

trans-unit.source: One these are configured, the "Upload a File" Action is configured and can be used in your flow.
trans-unit.target: One these are configured, the "Upload a File" Action is configured and can be used in your flow.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, other actions can be configured as well.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, other actions can be configured as well.

trans-unit.source: To use the connector outside of a logic App, the REST APIs exposed by the connector can be leveraged.
trans-unit.target: To use the connector outside of a logic App, the REST APIs exposed by the connector can be leveraged.

trans-unit.source: You can view this API Definitions using Browse->Api App->OneDrive Connector.
trans-unit.target: You can view this API Definitions using Browse->Api App->OneDrive Connector.

trans-unit.source: Now click on the API Definition lens under the Summary Section to view all the APIs exposed by this connector.
trans-unit.target: Now click on the API Definition lens under the Summary Section to view all the APIs exposed by this connector.

trans-unit.source: Details of the APIs can be found at [OneDrive API Definition].
trans-unit.target: Details of the APIs can be found at [OneDrive API Definition].

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
